channel.title: Portforwarding
channel.description: i have a quick question that i havent been able to figure out the answer to no matter how hard i search. Q: My router is one of 2 in my network. the connection starts in my office from the modem, then into another router, then to my wireless router and then into my computer and stuff. so would i have to create the exception for my server ip in both routers? and if so, my WRT54GS router only allows a certain amount of characters in the exception box, so i cant type the full ip of my server in it. what should i do there?

item.title: Portforwarding
item.dc:creator: @robocz033 robocz033
item.description:
@robocz033 wrote:

so i should do the exception on both routers? ok, i can do that.

Read full topic

and what i should do because my server name doesnt fit in the exception box in my linksys router. so idkâ€¦

item.title: Portforwarding
item.dc:creator: @zammyking111 zammyking111
item.description:
@zammyking111 wrote:

Go to the computer that has the router then type in command prompt ipconfig then write down your default gateway then put the defualt gateway into the address bar

Read full topic
